Action areas - IFAD



































Action areas









©IFAD/GMB Akash 










IFAD’s investments support rural people so they can pull themselves out of poverty and build better lives.








We build resilience so rural communities have options and can weather crises skilfully.
We empower vulnerable groups to ensure that no one is left behind.
We enhance livelihoods and connect people to markets so that rural producers can prosper from their hard work.
We protect the environment and promote sustainable farming practices so that generations to come can thrive on a healthy planet.
Our aim? Rural areas are transformed into prosperous and profitable places to live.











Empowering rural people
















 Rural women Gender inequality is one of the biggest impediments to sustainable development. Without tackling its root causes, we cannot end global hunger and poverty 

  Explore more 
           
 

















 Rural Youth As the farmers and producers of tomorrow, rural young people have the potential to feed the world's growing population. 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Indigenous Peoples With their traditional knowledge and deep connection to their environments, we work with Indigenous Peoples to build a more inclusive, sustainable future. 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Persons with disabilities Equal opportunities enable persons with disabilities to thrive while transforming rural communities 

  Explore more 
           
 











Protecting the environment















 Climate and environment The lives of small-scale farmers are being upended by climate change. They need support to adapt to climate change and to protect the planet’s precious resources 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Biodiversity Rich and diverse ecosystems are essential to produce our food and protect us from climate change impacts 

  Explore more 
           
 













Enhancing livelihoods and markets















 Private sector The private sector drives entrepreneurship, employment and growth in rural economies, and is essential to eradicating poverty and hunger. 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Rural finance With access to finance, rural people can produce more, grow their enterprises, earn more and get through hard times. 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Markets and value chains Reliable market access and strong value chains boost productivity, increase incomes and strengthen food security 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Land and resources Ensuring rural people have access land and natural resources for food, shelter, income and resilience 

  Explore more 
           
 










Promoting sustainable farming
















 Water Water is essential for food systems, yet this precious resource is under threat. For rural communities to flourish, they must sustainably access and manage water 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Crops Small-scale farmers grow a third of the world’s food. In a rapidly changing world, they need support to do so sustainably. 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Livestock Supporting sustainable livestock production and value chains is key to eradicating poverty and hunger while addressing climate challenges. 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Fisheries and aquaculture Responsible stewardship of the world’s fisheries ensures better livelihoods and a healthier planet. 

  Explore more 
           
 











Building resilience















 Rural institutions and organizations Farmers’ organizations help rural people increase their incomes and output, share knowledge, access resources and influence policy dialogue. 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Remittances The funds sent home by migrant workers are a lifeline for rural families, helping to build resilience and support sustainable development 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Nutrition An investment in agriculture is an investment in nutrition. Farming shapes sustainable food systems that nourish rural people and break cycles of poverty. 

  Explore more 
           
 
















 Fragile contexts and crises By building resilience, rural people can better endure crises. 

  Explore more
